title: >>> GRAPES and RAISINS
body_text:
EDWARDS (3-0) vs. CARTY (0-5)
He's defeated "M Bizzle" Butler, stood toe to toe with southpaw Megill, and even torn down the great wall known as
F.L.T.
The undefeated
Mike Edwards
in an encounter with hands-down the most losing, unlucky warrior in award-winning headliner
Derek Carty
. And one thing was for sure; someones' "perfect" record was coming to a screeching halt.
Members of Team EDWARDS were overly thrilled at the chance to align with the most destructive captain of the modern era. It was no secret "The Crazy One" craved the thought of victory either, pulling out all the stops in the early-goings, rolling right through the first three.
Those on Team CARTY got the hint loud and clear; pull the miraculous "Average Joes" come-from-behind win or go home utterly humiliated from a devastating defeat.
By Game 4 however, Carty had seized momentum of the match and took two rounds of his own. It was anybody's ball game from here on out ..
At every possible juncture throughout the fierce war, each army utilized their unlimited talents to claim the win. Neither man would fall that easily. The unforgiving rubber bulletballs ripped skin and numbed limbs. Hell, if there was a kitchen sink, you can bet that would have been hurled too!
At the 10:20 mark, Carty and his supporting cast did everything in their God-given power to tie it up. It beats the hell out of yet another defeat. But in the end, Edwards would hang on, taking the deciding 10th game.
Flash Results by Game
: 1, 2, 3, 6, 8, 10 (Edwards); 4, 5, 7, 9 (Carty)
Congratulations are certainly in order to Edwards, his untouched streak still in tact. Though he came up short, make no mistake about it, the high-flyin' Carty has been and always will be one of the finest athletes to ever grace the dodgeball court. We have not seen the last of this fearless superstar.
Mike Edwards defeated Derek Carty, 6 - 4.
Moments & Stars
: Ryan Letsche's incredible one-handed catch; an unsuspecting Juan Londono receiving a powerful nutshot at the hands of Mike "Sputz"; Juan Londono angrily launching a Starbucks muffin in retaliation to the pain he had just endured; John Tronolone twice smacking Lenny Herrera in the face with bulletballs, as well as the night-ending nutshot on Travis Mills; Diana DiBuccio's Game 7 catching streak; Brent Bitsko feeling the effects of a Ryan Letsche-thrown bulletball to the lower back; Sara DeCuir also on the receiving end of a dreaded facehsot
"Here Comes the Muffin Man!"
On behalf of each and every DODGEBALL CX2 participant, "thank you" to: Bob Cornero for generously bringing several boxes of Starbucks goodies and Luke for once again treating all to some delicious pizza.
Online Exclusive!
The original match for DODGEBALL CX2 [as announced at DODGEBALL CX] was to see Rob Pellecchia challenge Kevin Megill. The idea was swept under the carpet almost immediately however as a scheduling conflict prevented the two from going at it (*note how neither Pellecchia nor Megill were present at CX2). The
Edwards/Carty
clash was moved with the captains' approval, from its original spot at DODGEBALL 114 on December 1 to just this past weekend at DODGEBALL CX2.
RECORDS
> Attendance: 26
> Notable Returns: Derek Carty (last competed at DODGEBALL 100)
> New Players: (2) Michaella Dooley, Julio Herrera
- DODGEBALL CX2 kept the dry weather streak alive, this being the 21st consecutive event that was not a
Wet War
.
- In the main event, Mike Edwards boosted his perfect record to 4-0-1 taking down Derek Carty whose record now stands at a 0-6. Carty is only the second competitor in history to lose six matches, the first being John Tronolone. All of Carty's matches have been in standard singles contests.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
The feverishly awaited fourth ... the rivalry of the year when
WALL
battles
ALL
.
A Thanksgiving Special indeed.
Check it out November 24.
History Section
Round 1:
DODGEBALL 93
Round 2:
DODGEBALL 97
Round 3:
DODGEBALL CVII

EDWARDS (3-0) vs. CARTY (0-5)

He's defeated "M Bizzle" Butler, stood toe to toe with southpaw Megill, and even torn down the great wall known as F.L.T. The undefeated Mike Edwards in an encounter with hands-down the most losing, unlucky warrior in award-winning headliner Derek Carty. And one thing was for sure; someones' "perfect" record was coming to a screeching halt.

Members of Team EDWARDS were overly thrilled at the chance to align with the most destructive captain of the modern era. It was no secret "The Crazy One" craved the thought of victory either, pulling out all the stops in the early-goings, rolling right through the first three.

Those on Team CARTY got the hint loud and clear; pull the miraculous "Average Joes" come-from-behind win or go home utterly humiliated from a devastating defeat.

By Game 4 however, Carty had seized momentum of the match and took two rounds of his own. It was anybody's ball game from here on out ..

At every possible juncture throughout the fierce war, each army utilized their unlimited talents to claim the win. Neither man would fall that easily. The unforgiving rubber bulletballs ripped skin and numbed limbs. Hell, if there was a kitchen sink, you can bet that would have been hurled too!

At the 10:20 mark, Carty and his supporting cast did everything in their God-given power to tie it up. It beats the hell out of yet another defeat. But in the end, Edwards would hang on, taking the deciding 10th game.

Flash Results by Game: 1, 2, 3, 6, 8, 10 (Edwards); 4, 5, 7, 9 (Carty)

Congratulations are certainly in order to Edwards, his untouched streak still in tact. Though he came up short, make no mistake about it, the high-flyin' Carty has been and always will be one of the finest athletes to ever grace the dodgeball court. We have not seen the last of this fearless superstar.

Mike Edwards defeated Derek Carty, 6 - 4.

Moments & Stars: Ryan Letsche's incredible one-handed catch; an unsuspecting Juan Londono receiving a powerful nutshot at the hands of Mike "Sputz"; Juan Londono angrily launching a Starbucks muffin in retaliation to the pain he had just endured; John Tronolone twice smacking Lenny Herrera in the face with bulletballs, as well as the night-ending nutshot on Travis Mills; Diana DiBuccio's Game 7 catching streak; Brent Bitsko feeling the effects of a Ryan Letsche-thrown bulletball to the lower back; Sara DeCuir also on the receiving end of a dreaded facehsot

"Here Comes the Muffin Man!"
On behalf of each and every DODGEBALL CX2 participant, "thank you" to: Bob Cornero for generously bringing several boxes of Starbucks goodies and Luke for once again treating all to some delicious pizza.

Online Exclusive!
The original match for DODGEBALL CX2 [as announced at DODGEBALL CX] was to see Rob Pellecchia challenge Kevin Megill. The idea was swept under the carpet almost immediately however as a scheduling conflict prevented the two from going at it (*note how neither Pellecchia nor Megill were present at CX2). The Edwards/Carty clash was moved with the captains' approval, from its original spot at DODGEBALL 114 on December 1 to just this past weekend at DODGEBALL CX2.

RECORDS
> Attendance: 26
> Notable Returns: Derek Carty (last competed at DODGEBALL 100)
> New Players: (2) Michaella Dooley, Julio Herrera

- DODGEBALL CX2 kept the dry weather streak alive, this being the 21st consecutive event that was not a Wet War.
- In the main event, Mike Edwards boosted his perfect record to 4-0-1 taking down Derek Carty whose record now stands at a 0-6. Carty is only the second competitor in history to lose six matches, the first being John Tronolone. All of Carty's matches have been in standard singles contests.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

The feverishly awaited fourth ... the rivalry of the year when WALL battles ALL.

A Thanksgiving Special indeed.
Check it out November 24.

Round 3: DODGEBALL CVII
